stimulusHtml:
Source: Kevin Kallaugher for The Economist magazine, June 24, 2008.

 

The cartoon above suggests that globalization has
choicesHtml: grown to a point such that rising population is going to destabilize many world economies
worn out the United States economy because too many other economies are based on consumer goods
stoked the greed of corporations that will soon lead to their downfall and the start  of a workers’ revolution
prompted the United States to push other countries to move their economies to become more market based
entwined global economies to a point such that economic weakness in one affects the others
